intro: Coniogramme latibasis, commonly known as the broad-leaved coniogramme, is a flowering plant belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive, broad base. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Coniogramme latibasis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
